1.title: Het verhaal van het begin
1.plot: Together with writer Kolet Janssen, Patrick Lateur goes to find traces of the first Christians in Rome. They visit places that show how it all started, places that tell why people chose to become Christians in the early days. They descend into the catacombs of Callixtus and find special frescoes with biblical scenes. They search for the meaning of the mosaics of San Clemente and Santa Maria Maggiore. And they discover that one of the most beautiful Caravaggio's, The Call of Matthew, tells a story that is more current than ever.

2.title: In het spoor van Ignatius en Jan Berchmans
2.plot: Together with Mark Rotsaert, Jesuit and professor at the Gregoriana, Patrick Lateur enters in the footsteps of Ignatius of Loyola and his Flemish follower Saint-Jan Berchmans. They visit Rome's richest baroque churches with the lavishly decorated tombs of these two special saints. How does the wealth, the splendor and the pomp in these churches relate to the Christian faith that preaches simplicity and sobriety? Ignatian spirituality is addressed in the Ignatius death chamber. 4.title: Gezonden tot dialoog
4.plot: Jan Dumon takes Patrick Lateur to places in Rome that are important to him. The dialogue between Christianity and other world religions is what it's all about. After a visit to the early Christian Santa Sabina they walk over the Tiber Island to the great synagogue of Rome. A perfect place to reflect on the relationship between Jews and Christians. Through the statue of the Christian rebel Giordano Bruno they go to the largest mosque in Europe on the edge of the eternal city.
